poem:
Voices in the Desert

In the rust-colored dusk,
they stride with promises,
their words like whispers
against the barbed wire wind.
Beyond, a nation listens
to silence, to echoes—
awaiting the hour
when real voices rise
unfettered, unmirrored,
in the labyrinth of democracy,
Where shadows dream
of light once more.
